etymology.description: 火 ‘fire’ + 廾 ‘hands’ – fire that can be handled; embers, hot coals.
etymology.interpretation: Combines fire with two hands, evoking embers or coals hot enough to glow yet manageable by hand tools. Extends to the sense of blazing or burning heat.

examples.chinese: 炉中灷着一团火(爐中灷著一團火)。
examples.pinyin: Lú zhōng zhuàn zhe yì tuán huǒ.
examples.english: A fire is blazing in the stove.

examples.chinese: 风一吹，篝火灷得更旺(風一吹，篝火灷得更旺)。
examples.pinyin: Fēng yī chuī, gōuhuǒ zhuàn de gèng wàng.
examples.english: When the wind blows, the bonfire blazes even stronger.

examples.chinese: 他不小心把手指灷伤(他不小心把手指灷傷)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bù xiǎoxīn bǎ shǒuzhǐ zhuàn shāng.
